EQUIPMENT.NAME: All Grain - Large 10 Gal/38 l - Cooler
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: Popular 10 gallon/38 liter setup for all grain brewing. Uses a 10 gal/38 l water cooler as mash tun for single infusion mashes and a 15 gallon brew pot for full size boil of the 12+ gallons of wort.

EQUIPMENT.NAME: All Grain - Large 10 Gal/38 l - Stainless
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: Popular 10 gal/38 l batch setup for all grain brewing. Uses two large stainless 15 gal/58 l kegs or pots for the boil pot and mash tun with the tops cut off the keg. A third keg or large pot is often used as a pot to heat mash tun water.

EQUIPMENT.NAME: All Grain - Mini 3 Gal/11.3 l - BIAB Stovetop
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: Mini Brew-in-a-bag stovetop all grain batch with a a 3 gal/11l target batch volume designed to fit in a 5-6 gal pot. Note that pot size dictates how much grain can be used and you may need more than 5 gal/19 l for higher gravity beers. Please use a BIAB mash profile with this setup to get the proper mash volumes.

EQUIPMENT.NAME: All Grain - Standard 5 Gal/19l Batch - Cooler
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: Popular all grain setup. 5 Gal/19 l Plastic cooler as mash tun with false bottom, and 7-9 gallon brewpot capable of boiling at least 7 gal of wort without spilling over. Primarily used for single infusion mashes.

EQUIPMENT.NAME: All Grain - Standard 5 Gal/19l Batch - Stainless
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: Popular all grain setup. 5 Gal/19 l stainless pot as mash tun with false bottom, and 7-9 gallon brewpot capable of boiling at least 7 gal of wort without spilling over. Primarily used for single infusion mashes.

EQUIPMENT.NAME: BIAB - Large 10 Gal/38 l Batch
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: Sample Brew-in-a-bag equipment profile set up for a 20 Gal/70 liter brewing pot (diameter of 45cm or 18 inches) and using a polyester grain bag to hold the grain. This profile should be used with the BIAB mash profiles available in the BeerSmith mash profiles area. The above assumes loose pellet hops and only clear, chilled wort transferred from the kettle using no trub management techniques. Experienced brewers should adjust 'Loss to Trub and Chiller' and 'Brewhouse Efficiency' accordingly to suit their trub management techniques. Careful when mashing in as this profile approaches the pot limits.

EQUIPMENT.NAME: BIAB - Standard 5 Gal/19 l Batch
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: Sample Brew-In-A-Bag equipment profile set up for a 15 Gal/50 litre brew pot (diameter of 40cm or 16 inches) using a polyester grain bag to hold the grain. This profile should be used with the BIAB mash profiles available in the BeerSmith mash profiles area. The above assumes loose pellet hops and only clear, chilled wort transferred from the kettle using no trub management techniques. Experienced brewers should adjust 'Loss to Trub and Chiller' and 'Brewhouse Efficiency' accordingly to suit their trub management techniques.

EQUIPMENT.NAME: BREWTREE- 15 Gallon Brewing System
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: BREWTREE 15 gallon brewing system -- see www.brewtree.com

EQUIPMENT.NAME: Brew Pot (2 Gallon)
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: Simple brew pot with 2 gallon capacity for extract brewing. May also be used for partial mash with temperature or infusion mashing.

EQUIPMENT.NAME: Brew Pot (3 Gallon)
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: Simple Brew Pot with a 3 Gallon Capacity - leaving a workable boil volume of around 2.5 gal. Used for extract or partial mash brewing.

EQUIPMENT.NAME: Brew Pot (4 Gallon)
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: Simple Brew Pot with a 4 Gallon Capacity - leaving a workable boil volume of around 3.25 gal. Used for extract or partial mash brewing.

EQUIPMENT.NAME: Brew Pot (5 Gallon)
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: Simple Brew Pot with a 5 Gallon Capacity - leaving a workable boil volume of around 4.25 gal. Used for extract or partial mash brewing.

EQUIPMENT.NAME: Brew Pot (6+gal) and Igloo/Gott Cooler (5 Gal)
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: Popular all grain setup. 5 Gallon Gott or Igloo cooler as mash tun with false bottom, and 7-9 gallon brewpot capable of boiling at least 6 gallons of wort. Primarily used for single infusion mashes.

EQUIPMENT.NAME: Brew Pot (12.5 gal) and Igloo Cooler (10 Gal)
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: 12.5 gallon Turkey Fryer with 10 Gal. Igloo Mash Tun

EQUIPMENT.NAME: Brew Pot (15 Gal) and Igloo/Gott Cooler (10 Gal)
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: Popular 10 gallon setup for all grain brewing. Uses a 10 gallon water cooler as mash tun for single infusion mashes and a 15 gallon brew pot for full size boil of the 12+ gallons of wort.

EQUIPMENT.NAME: Brew Pot (7.5 gal) and Cooler (48 qt)
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: 30 qt (7.5 gal) Turkey Fryer with 48 qt cooler Mash Tun

EQUIPMENT.NAME: Brew Pot (7.5 gal) and Igloo Cooler (10 Gal)
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: 30 qt (7.5 gal) Turkey Fryer with 10 Gal. Igloo Mash Tun

EQUIPMENT.NAME: Cider - Large 10 Gal/38 l Batch
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: Double size 10 gal/38 liter setup for no-boil cider. Typically the primary fermenter is a large plastic bucket or fermenter for easy of access. Cider is often aged in a carboy or keg.

EQUIPMENT.NAME: Cider - Mini 3 Gal/11.3 l Batch
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: Mini 3 Gal/11.3 setup for no-boil cider. Typically the primary fermenter is a 5 gal/19 l or larger plastic bucket for easy of access. Cider is often aged in a carboy or keg.

EQUIPMENT.NAME: Cider - Standard 5 Gal/19 l Batch
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: Standard 5 gal/19 liter setup for no-boil cider. Typically the primary fermenter is a 7.5 gal/28 l or larger plastic bucket for easy of access. Cider is often aged in a carboy or keg.

EQUIPMENT.NAME: Electric Urn (10 Gal/40 L) - BIAB
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: Sample Brew-In-A-Bag equipment profile set up for a 40 litre electric urn (diameter of 38cm or 15 inches) using a polyester grain bag to hold the grain. This profile should be used with the BIAB mash profiles available in the BeerSmith mash profiles area. The above assumes loose pellet hops and only clear, chilled wort transferred from the kettle using no trub management techniques. Experienced brewers should adjust 'Loss to Trub and Chiller' and 'Brewhouse Efficiency' accordingly to suit their trub management techniques.

EQUIPMENT.NAME: Extract - Large 10 Gal/38 l Batch
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: Large 10 gal/38 l batch setup for all extract brewing. Uses 10 gal boil pot and 4 gal of top up water to avoid boil-overs.

EQUIPMENT.NAME: Extract - Mini 3 Gal/11.3 l Batch
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: Extract batch with a 3 gal/11l target batch volume designed to fit in a 3 gal pot. Uses about 1 gal/4 liters of top-up water.

EQUIPMENT.NAME: Extract - Standard 5 Gal/19 l Batch
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: Extract Setup for 5 gal/19 l brew pot - leaving a workable boil volume of around 4.5 gal. Used for extract or partial mash brewing. Note top-up water is still required as we can't reach a full volume boil in this setup.

EQUIPMENT.NAME: Mead - Large 10 Gal/38 l Batch
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: Mead setup for the serious mead maker fermenting 10 gal/38 l at a time. No boil method. Uses 15 Gal bucket or keg for primary fermentation and carboys or kegs for aging.

EQUIPMENT.NAME: Mead - Micro 1 Gal/4 l Batch
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: Tiny 1 gal/4 liter mead setup. No boil method. Primary fermentation is done in a small 1.5-2 gal (6-8 l) bucket. Secondary and later fermentation is done in a 1 gal/4 l glass jug.

EQUIPMENT.NAME: Mead - Mini 3 Gal/11.3 l Batch
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: Mead mini batch with a 3 gal/11.3 l starting volume and no-boil method. Primary fermentation is usually done in a 5 gal/19 l bucket, and secondary is often done in glass or mini-kegs to avoid oxygen during longer aging periods.

EQUIPMENT.NAME: Mead - Standard 5 Gal/19 l Batch
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: Standard 5 gal/19 liter mead setup for no-boil mead. Typically the primary fermenter is a 7.5 gal/28 l or larger plastic bucket for easy of access. Meads are usually aged in glass carboys or kegs to avoid oxygen contamination during long aging periods.

EQUIPMENT.NAME: Pot ( 2 Gal/7.6 L) - Extract
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: Simple brew pot with 2 gallon capacity for extract brewing. May also be used for partial mash with temperature or infusion mashing.

EQUIPMENT.NAME: Pot ( 3 Gal/11.4 L) - Extract
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: Simple Brew Pot with a 3 Gallon Capacity - leaving a workable boil volume of around 2.5 gal. Used for extract or partial mash brewing.

EQUIPMENT.NAME: Pot ( 4 Gal/15.1 L) - Extract
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: Simple Brew Pot with a 4 Gallon Capacity - leaving a workable boil volume of around 3.25 gal. Used for extract or partial mash brewing.

EQUIPMENT.NAME: Pot ( 5 Gal/19 L) - Mini-BIAB
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: Sample Brew-In-A-Bag equipment profile set up for a 19 litre pot (diameter of 29cm or 15 inches) using a polyester grain bag to hold the grain. This profile should be used with the BIAB mash profiles available in the BeerSmith mash profiles area. As this is a small pot size, it may be necessary to hold back some mash water until after the bag has been removed to prevent over-flow. The above assumes loose pellet hops and only clear, chilled wort transferred from the kettle using no trub management techniques. Experienced brewers should adjust 'Loss to Trub and Chiller' and 'Brewhouse Efficiency' accordingly to suit their trub management techniques.

EQUIPMENT.NAME: Pot (13 Gal/50 L) - BIAB
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: Sample Brew-In-A-Bag equipment profile set up for a 50 litre brew pot (diameter of 40cm or 16 inches) using a polyester grain bag to hold the grain. This profile should be used with the BIAB mash profiles available in the BeerSmith mash profiles area. The above assumes loose pellet hops and only clear, chilled wort transferred from the kettle using no trub management techniques. Experienced brewers should adjust 'Loss to Trub and Chiller' and 'Brewhouse Efficiency' accordingly to suit their trub management techniques.

EQUIPMENT.NAME: Pot (18.5 Gal/70 L) - BIAB
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: Sample Brew-in-a-bag equipment profile set up for a 70 liter brewing pot (diameter of 45cm or 18 inches) and using a polyester grain bag to hold the grain. This profile should be used with the BIAB mash profiles available in the BeerSmith mash profiles area. The above assumes loose pellet hops and only clear, chilled wort transferred from the kettle using no trub management techniques. Experienced brewers should adjust 'Loss to Trub and Chiller' and 'Brewhouse Efficiency' accordingly to suit their trub management techniques. Careful when mashing in as this profile approaches the pot limits.

EQUIPMENT.NAME: Pot (18.5 Gal/70 L) and Cooler (9.5 Gal/40 L) - All Grain
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: Based on a 18.5 Gal/70 L pot with a diameter of 18 inches/45 cm and a 9.5 Gal/40 L cooler. The above assumes loose pellet hops and only clear, chilled wort transferred from the kettle using no trub management techniques. Experienced brewers should adjust 'Loss to Trub and Chiller' and 'Brewhouse Efficiency' accordingly to suit their trub management techniques.

EQUIPMENT.NAME: Pot (36L) - Mini-BIAB
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: Sample Brew-In-A-Bag equipment profile set up for a 36 litre pot using a polyester grain bag to hold the grain. This profile should be used with the BIAB mash profiles available in the BeerSmith mash profiles area. As this is a small pot size, it may be necessary to hold back some mash water until after the bag has been removed to prevent over-flow. The above assumes loose pellet hops and only clear, chilled wort transferred from the kettle using no trub management techniques. Experienced brewers should adjust 'Loss to Trub and Chiller' and 'Brewhouse Efficiency' accordingly to suit their trub management techniques.

EQUIPMENT.NAME: Pot and Cooler ( 5 Gal/19 L) - All Grain
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: Popular all grain setup. 5 Gallon cooler as mash tun with false bottom, and 7-9 gallon brewpot capable of boiling at least 6 gallons of wort without spilling over. Primarily used for single infusion mashes.

EQUIPMENT.NAME: Pot and Cooler ( 5 Gal/19 L) - Extract/Partial Mash
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: Simple Brew Pot with a 5 Gallon Capacity - leaving a workable boil volume of around 4.5 gal. Used for extract or partial mash brewing. Note top-up water is still required as we can't reach a full volume boil in this setup.

EQUIPMENT.NAME: Pot and Cooler (10 Gal/37.8 L) - All Grain
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: Popular 10 gallon setup for all grain brewing. Uses a 10 gallon water cooler as mash tun for single infusion mashes and a 15 gallon brew pot for full size boil of the 12+ gallons of wort.

EQUIPMENT.NAME: Stainless Kegs (10 Gal/37.8 L) - All Grain
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: Popular 10 gallon batch setup for all grain brewing. Uses two large stainless 15 gal/58 l kegs for the boil pot and mash tun with the tops cut off the keg. A third keg is often used as a pot to heat mash tun water.
